title: User Calculator Navigation and Usage
description: Verify users can navigate to the home page, use the dynamic dropdown to select a service module calculator, and open the calculator page successfully.

steps.description: Navigate to the home page
Locate and open the dynamic dropdown menu for calculators
Select each service provider module option (Civil, Electrical, HVAC) one by one
Open the selected calculator
Verify the calculator page loads with all relevant inputs and controls visible
Verify correct calculations are performed on valid inputs
Test navigation with no selection or invalid selection
Verify appropriate error or no action occurs without application errors

title: Theme Upload and Validation
description: Verify administrators can upload a new theme that passes validation rules and is rejected if invalid.

steps.description: Login as administrator
Navigate to /admin/themes
Upload a valid theme package
Verify the theme passes validation and is listed as available
Upload an invalid theme package (missing manifest or corrupted files)
Verify rejection with informative error messages

title: Theme Activation and Dynamic CSS Application
description: Verify administrators can activate a theme and see dynamic CSS applied correctly across the application.

steps.description: Login as administrator and go to /admin/themes
Select a validated theme and activate it
Verify the theme activation status updates successfully
Navigate through multiple pages and verify the new theme's CSS is applied dynamically without requiring full page reload
Customize theme settings
Verify customized settings persist and reflect visually

title: Plugin Upload, Manifest Validation, and Activation Toggle
description: Verify administrators can upload new plugins with valid manifests, toggle activation, and that invalid plugins are rejected.

steps.description: Login as administrator and access the plugin management section
Upload a valid plugin including correct manifest file
Verify plugin is accepted and listed with accurate details
Upload an invalid plugin missing or with incorrect manifest
Verify upload is rejected with clear validation errors
Toggle plugin activation ON and OFF
Verify system reflects plugin activation state without errors
Delete a plugin
Verify plugin is removed and no residual files or references exist

title: Backup Creation, Export, Restore, and Download
description: Verify full system backup creation including database and assets, export and download of backup files, and restoration of system state from backups.

steps.description: Login as administrator and navigate to /admin/help
Create a new backup capturing database dump and theme/plugin assets
Verify backup is completed successfully with expected file artifacts
Download the backup file
Verify backup file downloads fully and is not corrupted
Restore the system from the created backup
Verify system state is restored correctly, including themes, plugins, and data
Attempt backup creation when storage is full or permission denied
Verify proper error handling and messages

title: Audit Log Viewer Filtering and File Download
description: Verify administrators can access audit logs, apply filters with various criteria, and download filtered audit logs correctly.

steps.description: Login as administrator and navigate to /admin/audit-logs
Apply filters using date range, user, event type, and severity
Verify audit log entries reflect applied filters accurately
Download the filtered audit log entries
Verify the downloaded file matches applied filters and is not corrupted
Apply filters that yield no results
Verify the system shows appropriate 'no entries' message without errors

title: Admin POST Routes Rate Limiting and CSRF Protection
description: Verify that administrative POST routes enforce rate limiting and CSRF token validation to maintain security and prevent abuse.

steps.description: Login as administrator and obtain valid CSRF token
Issue multiple POST requests to admin endpoints within allowed rate limits with valid CSRF token
Verify requests succeed without blocking
Issue POST requests exceeding rate limits
Verify requests are rejected with rate limit error messages
Issue POST requests with missing or invalid CSRF tokens
Verify requests are rejected due to CSRF validation failure

title: Structured Logging and Audit Logging Verification
description: Verify that system generates structured logs and audit logs contain necessary information for compliance and traceability.

steps.description: Trigger system events such as login, calculator usage, theme activation, plugin upload, backup creation
Verify logs are generated with consistent structured format including timestamp, user, event type, and details
Verify audit logs properly record administrative actions with necessary context
Review logs for presence of error or warning entries upon erroneous operations
Verify all critical errors are logged with sufficient detail

title: API v1 Health Endpoint Status and Response Validation
description: Verify the /api/v1/health endpoint returns HTTP status 200 and valid JSON payload indicating system health.

steps.description: Send a GET request to /api/v1/health
Verify HTTP response status is 200 OK
Verify response body is valid JSON and contains expected health status keys
Simulate system degraded or unavailable state (e.g. database down)
Verify /api/v1/health returns appropriate non-200 status and error information

title: API v1 Calculators and History Endpoints Data Consistency
description: Verify API endpoints providing calculator data and user calculation history respond correctly with valid data and error handling.

steps.description: Send GET requests to /api/v1/calculators for each service module
Verify response includes correct calculator metadata and configuration in JSON format
Send GET requests to /api/v1/history for authenticated users
Verify response returns user calculation history accurately
Send GET requests with invalid parameters or unauthorized access
Verify proper error responses and status codes are returned
